snippet: Apple faces two threats: one from hackers looking for ways to steal financial information, and another from regulators interested in ensuring that information gleaned from health monitoring devices stays private.
abstract: Apple's health-monitoring technology and new service that will allow people to buy things wirelessly with some Apple devices has positioned company as caretaker of valuable personal information and serious data company; Apple faces threat of hackers looking for ways to steal such information; regulators are increasingly interested in ensuring information gleaned from health monitoring devices stays private.

byline.original: By BRIAN X. CHEN and STEVE LOHR
byline.contributor: Brian X. Chen reported from San Francisco, and Steve Lohr from New York. Nicole Perlroth contributed reporting from San Francisco.

lead_paragraph: Apple faces two threats: one from hackers looking for ways to steal financial information, and another from regulators interested in ensuring that information gleaned from health monitoring devices stays private.

headline.main: With Apple Pay and Smartwatch, a Privacy Challenge
headline.print_headline: With New Apple Products, a Privacy Challenge
